summary: [Scrolling] Add option to block scrolling when grid popups are open (editor popups, Context Menu)
Using array of arrays format for bar/column/area series' yKeys results in the same colors for all stacks
[Regression] When using autoHeight columns and scrolling vertically, cell text flickers when it gets rendered

[Regression] When cell class rules are used only the last class of the matching condition is applied to the cell

Chart themes doesn't accept a TimeInterval object for axes-tick-count

When using scatter/bubble chart with series labels, zooming in the navigator an exception is thrown and the navigator cannot be zoomed out anymore
[Regression] When setting the current column definitions, grid cells flash (by a call to setColumnDefs )
When selecting an item in the agRichSelectCellEditor and pressing TAB key the selected value isn't entered as the new cell value
When using full-row editing, pressing UP/DOWN ARROW keys in the popup of the agRichSelectCellEditor doesn't change the selected item
moreInformation: This is not a bug because as the console warning indicates: “AG Grid: popup cellEditor does not work with fullRowEdit - you cannot use them both - either turn off fullRowEdit, or stop using popup editors.”

summary: [Regression] When using master-detail and expanding a master row, its detail grid cannot be immediately accessed
moreInformation:
This is an intended change in behaviour.

The method rowNode.setExpanded() is now asynchronous. Before this change, each call to rowNode.setExpanded() resulted in the grid re-rendering. Now the grid will wait for setExpanded() to be called multiple times and batch them in the next animation frame and re-render once.

This gives significant performance boost when expanding 10's or 100+ rows.

To work around this, get the grid to flush its animation frames using api.flushAnimationFrames(). After this call the detailsGridInfo will be available. Plunker provided here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/3y0RywfERhRR7NXy

summary: When using aligned grids, removing a group column from the row group panel doesn't make it visible in aligned grid, only in source grid
moreInformation:
Row Grouping is not managed by Aligned Grids. The only events managed by Aligned Grids are as follows:
1) Horizontal Scroll
2) Column Hidden / Shown
3) Column Moved
4) Column Group Opened / Closed
5) Column Resized
6) Column Pinned

See docs: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/aligned-grids/#events

summary: [Accessibility] Allow column tool panel items to be announced with their index in the columns list and provide labels to checkboxes
When using the infinite row model and reordering the selected row above the rest of the rows with refreshInfiniteCache, the selected row cannot be de-selected anymore
Inaccurate type definition for GetContextMenuItemsParams['node']
When displaying an image inside a grid cell, that image cannot be dragged like an image outside of the grid (dragging the image, not the row)
[Accessibility] Allow announcing number of matching records after column filtering
moreInformation:
See this implemented using a workaround here:

Please follow the steps below:
 1. Open  https://plnkr.co/edit/PhaB6JBaHBG6HvFD   
 2. Open JAWS/NVDA  
 3. Open the floating filter for the COUNTRY column
  4. Uncheck AUSTRALIA

  Actual & Expected: NVDA/JAWS announces: Filter 40

summary: [Row Grouping] Prevent displaying a row drag handle or allowing entire row dragging when rows are grouped
[Accessibility] Allow column menu to indicate to screen readers it's a dialog (via an aria-role label)
When number axis.min/max config is used to limit the auto-detected data domain, series markers cluster at the edges of a chart
When using integrated charting, the series formatter doesn't get called
[Regression] When pivoting, changing the visibility of a column resets the aggFunc to 'sum'
[Angular] When using a function to provide gridOptions instead of a property, there's an increase in CPU usage
moreInformation:
This is a common issue when you call a function from a template in Angular. The solution to this lies in the application, not the grid.

We'd suggest the following:

  • Store the result of your function in a property and bind `gridOptions` to that
  • Try using a pipe
  • Change the default change detection to onPush
  • Replace your factory with an observable and have whatever updates the factory push a new value into that stream

summary: loadingCellRendererSelector not used when set on the Angular/React/Vue grid wrapper
[Docs] loadingCellRenderer, loadingCellRendererParams, loadingCellRendererSelector grid properties missing in API documentation
When using loadingCellRendererSelector a console error message is printed out saying it's an invalid property
[Regression] When using SSRM - calling refreshServerSideStore() closes the context menu
moreInformation:
The grid is treating the newly loaded data as new data, and thus hides the context menu. This is because if the data was in fact different, then the context menu would be out of sync with the data and may not make sense.

To keep the context menu, we need to tell the grid the data is in fact the same data, and it's OK to continue showing the context menu. This is done by implementing the callback getRowNodeId().

summary: When calling setColumnDefs, group row selection is broken
[Regression] When using declarative columns and an inline cell renderer, updating data closes all expanded filters tool panels
moreInformation:
Did not fix.

This is because of: AG-5144 [React] Add support for Reactive callbacks.

Each time the grid renders, a new instance of colDef.cellRenderer callback is created. This results in the Grid thinking its' a new function (which it is) which means the grid thinks the Column list has changed. Because the Column list has changed, the Filter’s toolpanel refreshes which closes all Filters.

To get around this put the Cell Renderer into a useCallback(). That way it is not a new instance each time the component is re-rendered. Show in this example:

https://plnkr.co/edit/xPpKgKJ4rTx4beFE

summary: When using MacOS and only showing the scroll bar when scrolling, cells appearing under the scrollbar are visible but not clickable
When using stacked 100% chart type (normalized column, normalized bar, normalized area), the Y-axis labels should end with '%'
When using reactUI and the getRowStyle callback, an exception is thrown
[Docs] Correct broken links to stylesheet files in documentation segments
Row drag not updated after a call to api.setColumnDefs
When using the grid with pinned columns on any browser on OSX there's incorrect border between the main viewport and that of the pinned column
[Typing] Update typing for return value of CellRendererSelectorFunc to include undefined
[Regression] When enableCellTextSelection=true, dragging a row highlights text across cells
When many extra DOM elements are rendered on a page, focusing a grid cell happens after a delay
When setting domLayout="print" grid fits within the current page instead of increasing its width, causing columns to get clipped
[Typing] Add Cell Renderer function params
[Charts] Formatting axis labels using a format string does not work for SI units
When a column header cell is focused and then refreshed via refreshHeader(), focus is lost
When the grid has a cell range selected, clicking the drag handle element focuses the cell and clears the selected cell range
moreInformation: This is expected behavior, so rejecting this as not a bug. The task to changing this default behavior is tracked by AG-4489 - please use this reference.

summary: When using full-width group rows, cellClass doesn't get called
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior. Full-width rows (groupUseEntireRow=true), don't use autoGroupColumnDef or cellClass. 

In order to style a full-width row, you should use getRowClass instead:
https://plnkr.co/edit/Cqfa3j0VdprEgFYZ

summary: [React] Typings for React tooltips are missing
[Regression] When changing column visibility, the column menu popup moves and is clipped by the viewport
[Regression] When entering a value which produces no matches in the filter value input, the filter popup is moved and clipped on the right
[Accessibility][Keyboard Navigation] Allow focus to move from the sidebar button into the active tool panel controls
[Accessibility] Allow correct announcements for the column menu tabs (via the use of role=tablist)
moreInformation:
Implemented as standard in v26.1. For earlier versions, see workaround producing the correct column menu tab announcements here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/UjtxNM3yZIztx6ys

summary: [Accessibility] Resolve broken ARIA label reference error for column header cell select-all checkbox
[Pivoting] Improve pivoting calculation performance on large datasets ( > 50K rows)
[Accessibility] Allow filter tool panel items to be expanded using the SPACE key and announce their current expanded/collapsed state
[Accessibility] Allow JAWS screen reader to announce visible records when using pagination after previous/next button clicked (using aria-live regions with paging)
moreInformation:
In older versions of AG Grid which don't offer this out of the box, you can address this by setting the ARIA properties on the pagination panel controls manually, as shown below:
https://plnkr.co/edit/hlAzj592xrRsdzte

summary: [Accessibility] Add ARIA form label to checkboxes in column tool panel
[Column Tool Panel] Allow drag&drop to reorder columns inside Columns tool panel
[API] Add column API to IToolPanelParams
[Drag & Drop] Entire Row Dragging without the need for a drag handle
When you paste a new value in a cell, rowClassRules do not get refreshed
[Range Selection] Allow disabling the Fill Handle on a per-column basis
[API] Add "column" and "node" as additional params in keyCreator callback
[Accessibility] Add ARIA label to filter tool panel - filter columns input
[API] Allow colDef.template to take a callback with params specifying the column and other useful information
[API] Add the api param to NavigateToNextCellParams
[Regression] Editor popups don't keep relative positioning to grid when viewport scrolled
Vue 3: params not available inside setup function
[Framework] Add support for grid components that use vue-class-component and/or vue-property-decorator
When using frameworks like Next.js, a race condition causes an error - ReferenceError: document is not defined
[Accessibility] Allow screen reader to announce correct row index when using column pinning
moreInformation:
Pinned columns are rendered in a separate viewport in a different container from the ones in the unpinned area, as these need to be scrolled separately. This places the DOM elements for the pinned area out of order from the ones for the unpinned area. AG Grid manages this correctly internally and sets the aria-rowindex value correctly on each row as per the WCAG standard. 

However, the screen reader doesn't read read the aria-rowindex value of the row, but instead uses its internal heuristics to infer the row index itself. As the aria-rowindex value is set correctly by AG Grid but not read by the screen readers, please submit an issue with the screen reader manufacturer.

summary: When using enableCellTextSelection=true, moving a row and then selecting rows including its earlier position, row moved earlier gets selected
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior which can be fixed by setting ensureDomOrder: true as recommended in the documentation here: 
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/clipboard/#using-enablecelltextselection

summary: [React] When updating columns via useState hook, the refresh method on Custom Header Component doesn't fire
moreInformation: Workaround - implement forwardRefs and useImperativeHandle to allow the react functional component to have access to the refresh method. Then use frameworkComponents on gridOptions instead of headerComponentFramework on the column definitions: https://plnkr.co/edit/p9GQkE2HayWhtiM4

summary: When exporting to Excel and the export file name contains a dot character, it prevents the addition of the correct Excel file extension
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior because you need to provide the entire file name including the file extension inside the fileName property value as shown here:
gridOptions.api.exportDataAsExcel({fileName: 'Trade.Details.14072021.23451.xlsx'});
 
Please see this illustrated below: 
https://plnkr.co/edit/cYj1oFkfMASzlhPn

summary: Update and Improve Types on Angular Interfaces
[Tool Panel] Remove unused old API showToolPanel
Add -grid to framework prefixes
Add source to setColumnWidth api's
Enhance Row Auto Height Support
moreInformation:
The way Auto Height is calculated has changed to a different pattern. The new design inspects the grid's auto height cells and changes the row height as the cells height change. This covers all of the required scenarios.

Previously the Auto Height worked by copying all auto-height cells into an off-grid container and measuring its height, however the off-grid container often wasn't in sync with the grid by having different style, missing async components etc.

With this new behavior, when column use auto height (colDef.autoHeight=true), there is no need to call gridApi.resetRowHeights() anymore, as the grid will automatically resize the rows when it detects a height change.

summary: [Integrated Charts] Remove deprecated processChartOptions() grid option callback
breakingChangesNotes: The previously deprecated processChartOptions() callback has now been removed. Please use Theme Based Configuration going forward.

summary: Make Column Hover and Opt In Feature
moreInformation: Added a property columnHoverHighlight to opt into column highlighting. When this property is set, the ag-column-hover CSS class is applied to the DOM and the provided themes provide the style.

summary: [Charts] When dynamically changing chart axes, they are not updated correctly

Remove pinnedrowCellRenderer
deprecationNotes:
Deprecated colDef.pinnedRowCellRenderer, colDef.pinnedRowCellRendererFramework, colDef.pinnedRowCellRendererParams.

Please use cellRendererSelector instead if you want a different Cell Renderer (or params) for Pinnned Rows.

2. Open dev console

summary: [Regression] When calling JSON.stringify on an integrated chart model, an exception is thrown
breakingChangesNotes: The chart property has been removed from the ChartModel to support serialisation. To access the chart use the new gridApi.getChartRef(chartId) which returns the chart instance.

summary: [Regression] When using an AngularJS component within a custom cell renderer, the cell is blank
Correct react wrapper bug/typo with async changes
[Regression] When allowDragFromColumnsToolPanel: true and dragging a column in the columns tool panel, it scrolls the grid viewport to move the column instead
When you have a cell range selected and call setColumnDefs, the selected range remains visible, but is empty when accessing it via API
Missing locale string for "Total" text in pivot column group total header
[Regression] [React] When using a React-based Cell Renderer Selector, cell renderer params is empty after data update
Missing locale string for average in status bar aggregation component
[Regression] When using tooltips on the rightmost column, the right border of both custom and standard tooltip is cut off
When a column header cell is focused and then refreshed via setColumnDefs(), focus is lost
[Regression] When using React components and setting autoHeight=true, row height doesn't increase and only fits a single line of text
moreInformation:
This issue is fixed as part of row height logic changes made as part of AG-5607.

If you urgently need to address this issue, we suggest using one of the two workarounds below:
a) Implement your own logic for setting the row height (as cell's don't have height, it's the row that has height). What you could do is style a custom cell renderer so that its contents wrap, and put a ResizeObserver on it and when the height changes, get the height of the row to also change.
b) Implement your Cell Renderer in plain JavaScript. This works fine with auto height.

summary: [Regression] When using the fill handle to drag a number value using scientific (exponential) notation to populate more than one cell, the grid throws an exception
When exporting to an Excel file with multiple sheets with styles on one grid but not another, the exported file is corrupted
[Regression] When using specific ESLINT configs, the build fails with an error related to ag-grid-base-icons
[Row Sorting] Allow setting sort directions for each group column separately
moreInformation: The underlying requirement to sort each level of the row group hierarchy separately is covered in AG-1153.

summary: [Layout & Styles] Update styles to no longer use deprecated API for division (use math.div() instead) to avoid console warnings when building
[Chart] Update the Angular dependency of the ag-charts-package to the latest version of Angular
[Regression] When a column has rowGroupIndex set to null or an integer, the column gets grouped even if rowGroup is not true
When exporting a hyperlink to Excel using non-ASCII characters in the link name, the Excel file is corrupted
[Regression][Angular] When using addGlobalListener, events don't get handled
When grouping on multiple column and applying column state with a modified rowGroupIndex property the grid doesn't update
When using React v17 with a framework component and an onClick event on the grid container which contains event.stopPropagation(), the onCellClicked grid event isn't fired
moreInformation:
This is not an AG Grid issue but instead a result of an intentional change part of React 17. Please see full discussion and ways to address here:
https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/20848

summary: When importing AgGridVue from the ag-grid-vue3 package - the loading overlay doesn't work
[Typing] Export interface ComponentSelectorResult through @ag-grid-community/core
moreInformation:
Due to API changes, the ComponentSelectorResult type is now removed and replaced by two separate types depending on the component:
CellRendererSelectorResult
CellEditorSelectorResult

Please use the type corresponding to the component you're working with.

summary: [React] Improve the speed of React component rendering
moreInformation: Fixed when using the new React rendering mode with reactUi=true. Please use this rendering mode when using React to resolve this issue.

summary: Cjs files are self-contained units preventing LicenseManager from recognizing the license key
breakingChangesNotes: The <code>.cjs<files> files previously included all AG Grid related dependencies. These files now only contain the relevant code for that module, which is the correct behaviour.

summary: [Charts] Add series marker labels for Bubble / Scatter charts
Allow valueGetter to work in cells where groupHideOpenParent is used
moreInformation:
Updates made as part of this item:
1) The valueGetter and valueFormatter work when using groupHideOpenParent.

2) The property showOpenedGroup works with groupHideOpenParent (previously it did not). Using this property, there is no need for using valueGetter and valueFormater, as the example provided was using valueGetter and valueFormatter to show the opened group, which is what this property does.

summary: [Regression] Row autoHeight doesn't work with cellRendererFramework and styled components
moreInformation: This issue was resolved by changes in row auto-height logic made as part of AG-5607. This is why it was marked as duplicate.

summary: [Chart] Add support for custom axis tick period
Row AutoHeight doesn't work with async components (disableStaticMarkup=true)
[Accessibility] Allow displaying the clicked column header cell as focused
moreInformation:
This focused column header appearance can be implemented with CSS as shown in the sample below:
https://plnkr.co/edit/POdeODKd0AKFWhV7?preview

summary: [Typing] Export the GroupCellRendererParams interface
[Column Filter] Allow set filter popup to be resized
[Typing] Add missing types to grid interfaces
When dragging a column header from the grid into the columns tool panel aggregation panel, the aggregated column is hidden
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior. You can keep the dragged columns visible by setting suppressDragLeaveHidesColumns: true as shown in sample: 
https://plnkr.co/edit/hXLKlbQ2D9vWtGbn

summary: [Charts] Add support for series marker labels in category series (line, column, stacked column, area, stacked area, etc)
[Typings] Add specific missing events and params types (overlay params types, some events)
[Columns Tool Panel] Allow user to resize/collapse the different areas (row groups, values, column labels) of the columns tool panel
[Typing] Allow for stronger typing of main classes in ag-grid
[React] React innerRenderer places a div inside a span
moreInformation:
To work around this issue, you should apply the CSS property display: inline-block; to the parent div (has a class of 'ag-react-container'). This will negate the default "block" display type of the div, so it should show inline with the other elements. 
This can be seen here: https://next.plnkr.co/edit/lEgeFZy4gE13dFeI


This is no longer an issue with the new React work (when prop reactUi=true). The new React work does not use portals, rather native React elements, so no extra span elements are getting created.

summary: [Row Grouping] Add option to maintain group order when sorting on non-group columns
[Typescript] Add typings for onFirstDataRendered event
When updating a cell with agRichSelectCellEditor, pressing TAB key moves focus to next cell but exits edit mode
moreInformation: This is expected behavior. When not using full-row edit mode, pressing ENTER  exits edit mode and pressing TAB will focus the next cell without putting it in edit mode. Please use full-row edit mode to keep editing other cells in the row after making a change to any one cell.

summary: [Tool Panel] Allow setting Tool Panel width (current/min/max/initial)
[Row Grouping] Allow sorting on non-grouped columns when the group column is sorted with a custom comparator
[Row Grouping] Allow sort comparators defined on columns to also sort group columns
ag-grid-vue3/@ag-grid-community/vue3 reactivity broken
When providing header tooltip content, it is unnecessarily sanitised even though it's not provided by the user
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior. If you want to render HTML content in the tooltip, please write a custom tooltip component containing this HTML content to encapsulate this better. 

The default column header tooltip component should mimic the browser tooltip and always escape the tooltip content. The behavior to escape tooltip content is consistent across the grid - filter , cell renderers, etc, as shown below:
https://plnkr.co/edit/xWf156QuM9tYsMtX

summary: When editing a group row cell in tree data, the cellRenderer init method is called instead of refresh
moreInformation:
This cannot be fixed.

As of version 26 (the next version), the Cell Renderer is completely destroyed when editing starts. This is in line with how Components work in frameworks (Angular, React etc), that when you take the Component out of the DOM, that is in effect destroying the component.

So when editing starts (Cell Editor inserted into the Cell), the Cell Renderer is destroyed.

summary: [Regression] When using tree data with groupSuppressAutoColumn: true and agGroupCellRenderer, group cell values at different levels are displayed with the same indentation
moreInformation:
Bug in users code.

They had "showRowGroup: orgHierarchy" but it should be "showRowGroup: true"
https://plnkr.co/edit/vd5qmWhuLZACb0Ex

summary: [Regression][React] When adding a prop to the grid component and then updating that prop through setState, the model updated and new columns loaded event are fired
moreInformation:
This is error in provided plunker.

The row data and column definitions are getting recreated each time the functional component is called.

To get around this, the variables need to be either a) useState or b) useMemo.

See updated plunker here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/qN3IAuP2Nx9lOSmi

In the updated plunker I used useState() for row data (as this usually changes) and useMemo for column definitions.

useMemo and useState and why these help is all React terms, please google :)

summary: When defining multiple group column definitions with the same groupId, they're not logically a part of the same group
moreInformation:
This isn't a bug with AG Grid. If you supply duplicate group or col id’s they will be modified by AG Grid so they're unique. For example, if you have two groups with groupId='myGroupId", the second one will have its groupId value changed to “myGroupId_1“. However, if you want to have separate column groups with the same groupId, you can define all your child columns under the same column group and then separate the child columns when the grid is loaded. This allows the separated child columns to be merged back with the original column group they belong to, as shown here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/2kuTIlEPQPvFuuXv

summary: When the grid mixin is imported in a nested CSS declaration, nested row groups do not have the appropriate padding-left
moreInformation: Duplicate of rejected bug AG-5404. Please see AG-5404 for more information.

summary: [Regression] When refreshing column header (calling refreshHeader()), the column menu/filtering popups are closed
moreInformation: Calling refreshHeader replaces the headerElement with a new one, causing the floating filter to be left without a parent, which then, destroys it. Please use CSS applied to the column header in case you'd like to modify its style.

summary: [Chart] When having more than 8 series in a chart, the existing series colors are repeated
moreInformation:
The default theme includes colors for 8 series. If you have more than 8 series, you can create your own theme with as many colours as you want. 

Here's how to add more colors to the palette:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-charts/themes/#making-custom-themes

summary: [Regression] When calling setRowData with setState when the debugger is run inside componentDidUpdate the grid is not displayed
moreInformation: This is a design change rather than a regression in 25.x. Some updates will take place in the next tick, which is what is being seen here.

summary: [Regression] When editing with an Angular/React-based custom cell editor component with a popup and stopEditingWhenCellsLoseFocus: true, the popup element closes when clicked and the cell value is not updated
moreInformation: Component was using the ag-custom-component-popup flag without the component being marked as a popup. Adding a method isPopup that returns true to the component fixes this.

summary: [Regression] When using a mobile device (Android/iOS), a horizontal scrollbar is not displayed in AG Grid
moreInformation: Not a bug. This behavior was caused by user CSS code which prevented scrolling on mobile devices.

summary: [Regression] When using immutable data and modifying the data path of a row as part of an update, the row order is invalid
moreInformation: This is expected behavior because the affected rows were filler nodes, instead of real data rows. As these filler nodes contain no data property, there won’t be any filtering/sorting available on them. In order to have filtering/sorting available, please provide all nodes as real nodes from your dataset, instead of using filler nodes. Please see our documentation for a definition of filler nodes.

summary: [Regression] When infiniteInitialRowCount=0, the grid is displaying an initial row
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior, result of changes to ensure consistency between the infinite row model and the server-side row model. 

You can use a CSS Class Rule to hide the first loading row as shown here:
infinite row model: https://plnkr.co/edit/16tqA3EhMjtCWMI3
server-side row model: https://plnkr.co/edit/ZIEAaC6HYlUEqYL2

summary: [Firefox] When the horizontal scrollbar is visible and you're vertically scrolling the grid using the mouse wheel in Firefox on Windows, you can't scroll using the vertical scrollbar thumb anymore
moreInformation:
This is caused by an issue with Firefox. We have logged it here:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1722308

Please upgrade to a version of Firefox that fixes this issue to address this behavior.

As this isn't an issue with AG Grid, we have rejected this bug.

summary: [Regression] When calling redrawRows() API with custom cell renderers, the cell contents flash
moreInformation:
In 25.x a new default renderer was introduced that no longer used SSR to "pre-render" cells. This resulted in far better behaviour in general but hid the fact the force refresh destroyed and recreated cells (resulting in a flicker).

The solution to this is to either consider using a "soft" refresh and immutable data, or enable the legacy renderer by setting `legacyComponentRendering` on `AgGridReact`

summary: When adding new rows via setRowData, onNewRowsAdded doesn't have access to the new nodes to update the custom filter values
moreInformation:
You can resolve this by looping through the nodes in after a small timeout.

See illustrated here:
1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/fBh6hh2P9jsBWyEz
2. Open dev console
3. Open YEAR column filter
4. Click button above grid to add new row

Actual & Expected: Console shows messages displaying all the rows (including the new ones)


======== UPDATE

Should use gridApi.forEachLeafNode() instead.

There is a chicken and egg with forEachNode() and the CSRM - as the CSRM doesn't process the data until AFTER the filters have had their onNewRowsLoaded() called. This is because a filter could change (eg change it's filter state) which would then impact what the CSRM does (eg grouping depends on filters, as a filter could filter out a group).

However forEachLeafNode() doesn't depend on groups or filters, so can use this instead. This is what our Set Filter uses under the hood, so guaranteed to work.

If we were to swap the order (eg process CSRM first, filters second) this woudl create another problem. I'll update the docs with this info for anyone else creating custom filters.

summary: [Regression] When refreshing the row, React framework components don't have their useEffect hook fired
[Regression][React] When using tree data and modifying any state variable, column order in the grid is reset
moreInformation:
This is a problem with how the grid uses Declarative Column Definitions. In the future, we will be changing the recommended way of configuring columns to be JavaScript Definitions.

If the call moved to JavaScript Definitions, and memoised the column definitions, this would not be happening.

In order to fix for now, please set the following grid property:             maintainColumnOrder={true}

This will stop the grid reordering the columns each time new columns are set.

summary: [Regression] When using domLayout='autoHeight' with a single row, grid displays unnecessary whitespace that can fit a few more rows
When adding a class to ag-theme-custom-component.scss, selection checkbox padding is removed
moreInformation: This use case is not supported because the theme selector has to be at the root level. Please should use CSS variables instead to change any style as necessary.

summary: [Row Grouping] Allow correctly setting the group column key when using groupHideOpenParent=true and sorting to keep to group key in the top row
moreInformation:
This is already possible. When sorting the group column values using a non-group column, you need to add an extra sort (click the two buttons above the grid and note the year column values are sorted correctly):
https://plnkr.co/edit/5dJbYUa214Ru0u20

summary: callout.colors theme config has no effect in pie/donut charts
When exporting to Excel with a cell background color, background colors are correctly shown by Excel but missing in Excel for Office 365
When providing an invalid filterOption for the specific filter type, the grid throws an exception - it should be a warning
[Regression] When using SSRM and expanding a group row with an empty name, the group row chevron disappears
Saving and Restoring Charts Example doesn't work with Angular
When setting deprecated Excel export property skipGroups, hundreds of console warnings are output
When using a custom column header renderer and removing a column, a handled error appears
[Regression] When infiniteInitialRowCount>1 and providing new data to the infinite row model, the custom cell renderer doesn't re-render
[Regression] When updating the filter model on a column that uses custom filter options causes the default option key to appear in the floating filter
[Regression] When using SSRM before data is loaded, sorting by a column header throws an exception
When using SSRM with storeType=full and exporting to Excel, all records are exported, not just the filtered ones
[Regression] When using immutable data and removing a column, its valueGetter still gets called
[Row Grouping] Add "Open by Default" feature to the Client Side Row Model
When typing inside a agRichSelectCellEditor to search the items the incorrect item is highlighted
[Regression] When clicking a checkbox in the columns tool panel, the shadow is clipped along the left edge
When switching to legacy mode after ClipboardAPI is blocked by the user, the pasted value is blank
moreInformation:
Only the first paste would paste a blank value, while subsequent paste operations will work fine. This initial blank pasted value is unavoidable as the browser is first trying to use the Clipboard API, and when that fails, it falls back to the old legacy workaround that AG Grid has.

However the legacy workaround no longer works when we execute it directly after trying the Clipboard API. This is because of Chrome changing its behaviour around the API - this used to work before. Note that the Clipboard API is an experimental feature of Chrome, so it can change.

To get around this, the grid will try the Clipboard API once. If it fails, the grid will remember and never try it again. This means the paste will fail once only, and then succeed on all subsequent attempts (after Clipboard API fails, we will only use the AG Grid legacy way going forward).

In order to avoid the paste failing the first time because of the Clipboard API error, please either resolve the Clipboard API limitation (such as the user clicking DENY/BLOCK access to Clipboard API when opening the page), or set suppressClipboardApi=true to use the legacy clipboard implementation which doesn't rely on Clipboard API.

summary: When using server-side row model with serverSideFilteringAlwaysResets: true, filter is also applied client-side
When exporting to Excel empty cell values, keyboard navigation in Excel doesn't treat them as empty
Chart axis label rotation values are not updated in the formatting panel
[Regression] When using pivot mode and groupHideOpenParent=true, exporting to Excel doesn't export the cell values, only the column header values
When setting rightAligned on a group column, its header cell value gets right-aligned, but its data cells are still aligned left
When using groupMultiAutoColumn or groupHideOpenParent with total footer row, Total string is rendered for every group in the total footer row
[Regression] When filtering using custom React-Hook filter components an exception in thrown
When setting updated columnDefs with a different minWidth value, it doesn't get applied
Treemap should not render value labels for top level tiles
When using client-side row model with row grouping, calling getRowNode on a group node returns undefined
[Docs] Update the row models comparison to indicate that update transactions are no longer available in the infinite row model
Treemap tiles titles are clipped in Safari with larger font sizes
[Regression][Angular] When using infinite row model with cellRendererFramework, ngTemplate defined in a custom control is not applied
moreInformation:
An enhancement implemented in v25.2 is that IRM no longer destroys the loading row, instead it updates its values.

When the grid gets new values for a row, it checks to see if the value for a particular cell has changed, and if so it gets the Cell Renderer to refresh. If the value for that cell has not changed, the Cell Renderer is not refreshed.

Because there is no field or valueGetter provided for the column containing the Cell Comp, the grid isn't aware that the value has changed. To fix, add a field or valueGetter to the column with the custom Cell Renderer.

AG Grid has been updated so that it will always refresh if field, valueGetter and showRowGroup are missing (generally speaking one of these three are needed to show values, if they are all missing, then we always refresh rather than never refresh).

summary: [Regression] When using a floating filter, floating filter inputs and button get announced by JAWS and NVDA with each cell value
[Regression] When using enableRTL=true, column header dragging causes horizontal scrollbar to immediately go all the way to the right or cycle through the columns endlessly
When using drag and drop in the grid when hosted in a modal window, the ghost icon appears can't be seen by the user because it appears below the modal window
When using print layout with a pinned group column and a multi-level column group, sorting via API moves the group column header in the auto-group column area
When setting floatingFilter property in the columnType, the value is not respected by the column
ARIA labels for row drag handles contain an invalid reference
When pressing a key when a full-width row is focused, cellKeyDown and cellKeyPress events don't get fired
When using aligned grids in Chrome with Windows Display text scaling=150%, changing zoom level to 90% causes horizontal scrollbar to slowly move to the left by itself
[Regression] When using Internet Explorer 11 with flex/resizable columns in AG Grid, the set filter popup doesn't display the distinct values in the list
When using Safari with MacOS setting "show scroll bars"="auto based on mouse or trackpad" OR "when scrolling", the AG Grid vertical scrollbar thumb cannot be dragged using the trackpad
Read Only Floating Filter Doesn't Work With Hooks or VueJS
When setting cellRendererSelector in autoGroupColumnDef, an exception is thrown
When using server-side row model with store type=FULL removing the last remaining child of a row group or tree level, an exception is thrown
When using server-side row model with full store type with grouping, defaultGroupSortComparator isn't called
moreInformation:
We have updated the code to output a warning message if defaultGroupSortComparator is used with Server-Side Row Model or Infinite Row Model.

For server-side row model, storeType=full, then the client should pass the rows to the server-side row model sorted.
For server-side row model, storeType=partial, then sorting is done on the server side.
For Infinite Row model, sorting is done on the server side.

summary: When using SSRM with storeType=partial and showing 0 rows in grid, calling refreshServerSideStore doesn't make a request when purge=false
moreInformation:
There's a workaround you can use until this is resolved. Just set purge: true when the grid has 0 records to ensure a data request gets made. 

Please see this implemented here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/I8ewg40GcP7HGvOo

summary: When using server-side row model with full store type, returning an empty array in getRows() throws an exception
Multiple declarations of the same CSS classes with : and :: in the class name in themes fresh, dark, blue, bootstrap
[Chart] Add legend item label renderer
moreInformation: This was closed as a duplicate of AG-3116.

summary: When using MacOS, with Show Scroll Bars=When Scrolling, Chrome/Firefox don't show horizontal scrollbar unless you've scrolled vertically all the way down
Screen reader announces second set filter item as unchecked when it is checked
Setting fills and strokes on pie charts doesn't work for integrated charts
Allow setting the tabIndex of the Grid
When using a custom chart theme chart y-axis label rendered with rotation even though rotation=0
[API] Remove suppressSideButtons property from product and docs example
moreInformation: 'ToolPanelParams.suppressSideButtons' has no effect and doesn't belong in the columns TP params.

Make series tooltips use the same value format as axis labels

moreInformation: Closed as a duplicate. Please track this requirement in AG-4240.
